paragraphs.title: Input and output file names
paragraphs.text:
val folder = "recsys-2017-tutorial/"

val startTimestamp = {
    val infile_reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.FileReader(folder + "data.csv"))
    val s =infile_reader.readLine().split(",")(0).toLong
    infile_reader.close()
    s
}

val inputPath = "week_"
val outputPathBatch = "ndcg.batch.out"
val outputPathOnline = "ndcg.online.out"
val outputPathBatchOnline = "ndcg.batchonline.out"
val modelPath = "model"
val dayInSec = 86400

paragraphs.title: Slicing the data in python
paragraphs.text:
%python
# we slice the data into week long intervals to simplify the flink code

import pandas as pd

week = 604800

folder = "recsys-2017-tutorial/"

data = pd.read_csv(folder + "data.csv", names=["time","user","item"],sep=",")

start_time = data.time[0]

for i in range(15):
    data[(data.time > (start_time + i*week)) & (data.time <= (start_time + (i+1)*week))].to_csv(folder + 'week_'+str(i+1), index=False, header=False)


data[data.time < (start_time + 15 * week)].to_csv(folder + "week_all", index=False, header=False)

%md

# Online training

First we train and evaluate the matrix factor model using asynchronous SGD. Every record is evaluated using online NDCG and then is used to train the model; the results of the evaluation are written to disk.

This next paragraph may run for a few minutes; however, in this time it simulates the online training and evaluation over the whole 15 week period.

msg.data:
Online training

First we train and evaluate the matrix factor model using asynchronous SGD. Every record is evaluated using online NDCG and then is used to train the model; the results of the evaluation are written to disk.

This next paragraph may run for a few minutes; however, in this time it simulates the online training and evaluation over the whole 15 week period.

paragraphs.text:
val ratings = ImplicitDataToRatingParser.parse(senv, folder +  inputPath+"all", ",", 1, 2, 0, startTimestamp)

val topK = psOnlineLearnerAndGenerator(
        ratings,
        learningRate = 0.4,
        negativeSampleRate = 9)

nDCGSink.nDCGPeriodsToCsv(topK, folder + outputPathOnline + "all", dayInSec)

senv execute s"Online evaluation with learning"

%md

# Recommender functions

We define three functions to accomplish our tasks.

1. **BatchLearn** trains a factor model, iterating multiple times over the train data using asynchronous SGD
2. **OnlineLearnAndEvaluate** creates ranking predictions and evalutes then using online NDCG, while also training the model on every new rating using online SGD
3. **OnlineEvaluate** creates ranking predictions and evaluates them using online NDCG, however it doesn't alter the model

You can look up the functions used in the [documentation](http://info.ilab.sztaki.hu/~bdaniel/PSDocs/#package).

msg.data:
Recommender functions

We define three functions to accomplish our tasks.

  1. BatchLearn trains a factor model, iterating multiple times over the train data using asynchronous SGD
  2. OnlineLearnAndEvaluate creates ranking predictions and evalutes then using online NDCG, while also training the model on every new rating using online SGD
  3. OnlineEvaluate creates ranking predictions and evaluates them using online NDCG, however it doesn’t alter the model

You can look up the functions used in the documentation.

paragraphs.text:
/**
 * Learning in batch
 * @param   inputs  an array containing the names of input files
 * @param   output  the name of the output file
 */
def BatchLearn(inputs: Array[String], output: String) {
    val data = ImplicitDataToRatingParser.parseAll(senv, inputs.map(i => folder + i), ",", 1, 2, 0, startTimestamp)
    
    val factorModel = psOfflineMF(
      data,
      learningRate = 0.15,
      negativeSampleRate = 19,
      iterations = 4,
      pullLimit = 2200)
      
    factorModel.addSink(new VectorModelToFileSink(folder + output))
    
    senv execute s"generating model $output from $inputs"

}

/**
 * Evaluates a model with online learning
 * @oaram   input   the name of the input test data
 * @param   model   the name of the file containing the model
 * @param   output  the name of the output file
 */
def OnlineLearnAndEvaluate(input: String, model: String, output: String) {
    val ratings = ImplicitDataToRatingParser.parse(senv, folder + input, ",", 1, 2, 0, startTimestamp)
    val parsedModel = VectorModelFileParser.parse(senv, folder + model)
    
    val topK = psOnlineLearnerAndGeneratorWithModelLoad(parsedModel)(
        ratings,
        learningRate = 0.35,
        negativeSampleRate = 4)
        
    nDCGSink.nDCGPeriodsToCsv(topK, folder + output, dayInSec)
    
    senv execute s"Online evaluation of model $model with learning"
}

msg.data: OnlineLearnAndEvaluate: (input: String, model: String, output: String)Unit

paragraphs.text:
/**
 * Evaluates a model online without learning
 * @param   input   the name of the input test data
 * @param   model   the name of the file containing the model
 * @param   output  the name of the output file
 */
def OnlineEvaluate(input: String, model: String, output: String) {
    val ratings = ImplicitDataToRatingParser.parse(senv, folder + input, ",", 1, 2, 0, startTimestamp)
    val parsedModel = VectorModelFileParser.parse(senv, folder + model, numFactors = 10)
    
    val topK = psTopKGenerator(ratings, parsedModel)
        
    nDCGSink.nDCGPeriodsToCsv(topK, folder + output, dayInSec, false)
    
    senv execute s"Online evaluation of model $model without learning"
}

msg.data: OnlineEvaluate: (input: String, model: String, output: String)Unit

paragraphs.title: Python code to visualize the results
paragraphs.text:
%python

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# File paths (must be same as above)
folder = "recsys-2017-tutorial/"
inputPath = "week_"
modelPath = "model."
outputPathOnline = "ndcg.online.out"
outputPathBatchOnline = "ndcg.batchonline.out"
outputPathBatch = "ndcg.batch.out"

def plot(in_batch_than_online, in_batch, in_online):
    bto_score = pd.read_csv(folder+in_batch_than_online, header=None, names=["week", "inv", "ndcg", "hit"]).set_index("week")
    b_score = pd.read_csv(folder+in_batch, header=None, names=["week", "inv", "ndcg", "hit"]).set_index("week")
    o_score = pd.read_csv(folder+in_online, header=None, names=["week", "inv", "ndcg", "hit"]).set_index("week")
    (min_week, max_week) = (bto_score.index.min(), bto_score.index.max())
    plt.plot(bto_score['ndcg'], marker='o', color='Green', label='batch then online mf')
    plt.plot(b_score['ndcg'], marker='o', color='Red', label='batch mf')
    plt.plot(o_score['ndcg'][(o_score.index >= min_week) & (o_score.index <=max_week)], marker='o', color='Purple', label='online mf')
    plt.legend()
    plt.grid()
    plt.ylim(0,0.04)
    plt.show()

%md

# Model training

In this paragraph we use the functions defined above to train the model on the first 9 weeks and evaluate the batch model on a one week long period. We also evaluate the *batch then online* model, using the same trained batch model, over the same interval.

msg.data:
Model training

In this paragraph we use the functions defined above to train the model on the first 9 weeks and evaluate the batch model on a one week long period. We also evaluate the batch then online model, using the same trained batch model, over the same interval.

paragraphs.text:
%python
i = '10'

plot(outputPathBatchOnline+i,outputPathBatch+i, outputPathOnline+'all')

%md

# Evaluation over longer periods

To evaluate the models over 5 weeks while retraining in batch every week, we have to run the above process 5 times.

#### Warning: this following paragraph runs for a long time

pd.concat([pd.read_csv(folder+outputPathBatchOnline+str(i), header=None) for i in range(10,15)], axis=0).to_csv(folder+outputPathBatchOnline+'all',index=False,header=False)
pd.concat([pd.read_csv(folder+outputPathBatch+str(i), header=None) for i in range(10,15)], axis=0).to_csv(folder+outputPathBatch+'all',index=False,header=False)

plot(outputPathBatchOnline+'all',outputPathBatch+'all', outputPathOnline+'all')
